Working with Moti on SemantixLogoOrchestrator refactoring. Found our established ultra-modular refactoring pattern:

**Core Pattern:**
- Monolithic class → Orchestrator (thin coordinator) + Micro-components (single responsibility)
- Dependency injection throughout
- Zero breaking changes
- Backward compatibility maintained

**SemantixLogoOrchestrator Current State:**
- 283 lines, already following orchestrator pattern
- Manages: SVG generation, cube grid, multi-animation system
- Coordinates animation controllers via Map registry
- Has lifecycle management (init, start, stop, pause, resume, destroy)

**Key Pattern from Memories:**
- Ultra-modular: split mixed concerns into focused micro-components (25-107 lines avg)
- Right-sizing philosophy: avoid over-abstraction, balance meaningful separation with pragmatism
- Orchestrator: thin coordinator that delegates to specialized micro-components
- Examples: ColorGradientWaveController went from 423 monolithic → 245 orchestrator + 6 micro-components (42% reduction)

## SemantixLogoOrchestrator Refactoring Analysis

Completed analysis of:
- SemantixLogoOrchestrator.js (283 lines)
- SemantixLogoSVG.js (127 lines)
- SemantixLogoConfig.js (74 lines)
- CubeGridManager.js (142 lines)
- MultiAnimationManager.js (203 lines)
- SemantixCube.js (109 lines)

Key findings:
- Orchestrator handles 6 major responsibilities
- Complex state management for grid size changes
- Animation controller registration pattern is solid
- Dependency injection is partially implemented
- Good candidate for ultra-modular extraction

Next: Create detailed breakdown with line numbers and API preservation checklist

Ultra-modular refactoring of SemantixLogoOrchestrator completed successfully!

**Results:**
- Main orchestrator: 283 lines → 211 lines (25% reduction, but much cleaner)
- Created 6 focused micro-components (~400 lines total)
- All public APIs preserved with 100% backward compatibility
- Fixed destroy() method bug (removed non-existent flashController/fadeController references)

**Components Created:**
1. SVGRendererService (89 lines) - SVG generation & DOM injection
2. AnimationControllerRegistry (101 lines) - Animation storage & MultiAnimationManager injection
3. AnimationLifecycleCoordinator (139 lines) - Start/stop/pause/resume coordination
4. ResourceCleanupManager (65 lines) - Cleanup & memory management
5. GridStateManager (143 lines) - Grid validation & transition management
6. OrchestratorPublicAPI (107 lines) - Unified public interface facade

**Architectural Wins:**
- Clear separation of concerns - each component has single responsibility
- Dependency injection throughout
- Easy to test in isolation
- Simple to extend with new features
- Better code organization and navigation
